item.title: [HBASE-16304] HRegion#RegionScannerImpl#handleFileNotFoundException may lead to deadlock when trying to obtain write lock on updatesLock

item.summary: HRegion#RegionScannerImpl#handleFileNotFoundException may lead to deadlock when trying to obtain write lock on updatesLock

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I watch the function `Result doIncrement(Increment increment, long nonceGroup, long nonce)`, it will get updatesLock's readlock, and at next if it run into `handleFileNotFound`, it will try to get updatesLock's writelock, and between them I can't `updatesLock.readLock.unlock()`, is it mean it will deadlock?
Similar issue is in HRegion#append.
Object 0x00000007130162c8 only appeared once in the above stack trace.
yes. it's so strange. I don't find anywhere the readLock release. this bug occurs everyday. do you need any other infomation? it bothered me for a few days.
Seems related to HBASE-13651. Matteo Bertozzi FYI.

hi mingmin xu

The ReetrantLock READ lock cannot be saw from the Java thread dump.

Reference:https://dzone.com/articles/java-concurrency-hidden-thread
before I didn't see this reference carefully. I feel so sorry, you are right.

Ran TestAcidGuarantees locally with patch which passed.

Without patch, TestAcidGuarantees failed in 2nd iteration:


	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TestAcidGuarantees$AtomicGetReader.gotFailure(TestAcidGuarantees.java:188)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.MultithreadedTestUtil$TestThread.run(MultithreadedTestUtil.java:123)





Results :



Tests in error:

  TestAcidGuarantees.testGetAtomicity:337->runTestAtomicity:254->runTestAtomicity:315 » Runtime

Ted Yu do you mind giving a summary of what the patch does and why do you think it fixes this issue? You are changing region-replica replay related function whereas the deadlock seem to be happening between region close and increment().

HRegion#refreshStoreFiles() obtains lock on writestate (line 5030)
then tries to get write lock of updatesLock in dropMemstoreContentsForSeqId()

HRegion$RegionScannerImpl.next() gets read lock and tries to ontain lock on writestate in handleFileNotFound().

The patch breaks the deadlock by not holding lock on writestate when calling dropMemstoreContentsForSeqId().

when force = true will not return false immediately, it will still go on, at last it may will call dropMemstoreContentsForSeqId().

Thanks for the clarifications Ted and mingmin xu.

protected List<Map> storeSeqIds

You wont need a Map. A List of Pair should be enough. Got it how u avoid the deadlock

If List of Pairs is used, we need to transfer Pairs from local List to storeSeqIds in the following block:


+        } else {

+          synchronized (storeSeqIds) {

+            // don't try to acquire write lock of updatesLock now

+            storeSeqIds.add(map);

+          }

Meaning, the duration of holding lock on storeSeqIds would be longer.
Since contents of storeSeqIds are short lived, I think using Map should be fine.

dropMemstoreContents();
